intro: Voacanga glabra, commonly known as African locust bean, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by elongated, woody pods containing glossy, black seeds. It is often found in savanna and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a source of protein due to their high nutritional value.
